SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

cellularAutomata
Class Cell

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.Cell

public final class Cell
extends java.lang.Object

Contains all of the information about the state of a cell, previous states of the cell, rule(s) for changing state, and the current generation or time step (number of updates that have occurred). The states are typically 0 or 1, but they are stored in an object of type CellState. The rule(s) are typically addition modulo 2 of nearest neighbors, but the rule is stored in an object of type Rule.

Note that the cell does not keep track of its neighbors. The cellular automaton's lattice keeps track of the cell's neighbors. A cellular automaton lattice is a topology (or data structure) of connected cells.

IMPORTANT: most accessors and mutators in this class must be synchronized to be thread safe (or the instance variables must be volatile). For example, addNewState() updates the state and then the generation; between those two updates, a different thread might access the new state with the old generation. This can't happen if the method is synchronized. As importantly, one thread can't try to getGeneration() at the same time that another thread is updating the generation in addNewState(). This is because all the methods are under the same synchronization lock ("this" object), and only one thread is allowed to own a lock at any time.

Note that the state of the cell is not thread safe once it is returned by an accessor. Threads that access the state must not alter the state, or if they do, they must be synchronized (with this cell object as the lock).

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

Cell

public Cell(Rule rule,
            int maxNumStates,
            Coordinate coordinate)
Create a cell with rule for changing state. The initial states will be created as needed.

Parameters:
rule - The rule for updating state, usually dependent on the neighbors' state.
maxNumStates - The maximum number of states (including the current state) that will be remembered by the cell. Must be greater than 1, because it will keep track of at least its current state and one previous state.
coordinate - The position (row and column) of the cell. In one-dimension, the row is always 0.

Cell

public Cell(CellState state,
            CellStateView view,
            Rule rule,
            Coordinate coordinate)
Create a cell with a specific initial state and a rule for changing state. The cell will only keep track of the current state and the previous state.

Parameters:
state - The initial state of the cell (for example, 0 or 1).
view - The view used to display the cell.
rule - The rule for updating state, usually dependent on the neighbors' state.
coordinate - The position (row and column) of the cell. In one-dimension, the row is always 0.

Cell

public Cell(CellState state,
            CellStateView view,
            Rule rule,
            int maxNumStates,
            Coordinate coordinate)
Create a cell with a specific initial state, a rule for changing state, and the ability to keep track of a certain number of previous states.

Parameters:
state - The initial state of the cell (for example, a BinaryCellState storing a 0 or 1). If null, an appropriate state will be constructed.
view - The view used to display the cell.
rule - The rule for updating state, usually dependent on the neighbors' state.
maxNumStates - The maximum number of states (including the current state) that will be remembered by the cell. Must be greater than 1, because it will keep track of at least its current state and one previous state.
coordinate - The position (row and column) of the cell. In one-dimension, the row is always 0.
Method Detail

addNewState

public void addNewState(CellState state)
Adds a new state to the Cell. The current state of the cell is set to this state, and the previous state is set to the previously current state. Also increments the generation.

Parameters:
state - The new current state for the cell.

getCoordinate

public Coordinate getCoordinate()
Get the position (row and column) of the cell. In one dimension, the row is always 0.

Returns:
the position of the cell (row and column).

getGeneration

public int getGeneration()
Get the cell's generation (in other words, the time step, or the number of updates that have occurred).

Returns:
Returns the rule.

getOtherCellInformation

public java.util.Hashtable getOtherCellInformation()
Gets any other information that is stored in the cell. For example, the Margolus neighborhood needs the cell to keep track of its position as the northwest, northeast, southeast, or southwest corner of the neighborhood. (This information is not technically part of the cell's state so it is most appropriately stored in this location, separate from the state.)

In general, this method should be unnecessary. All information about the cell should be stored in the state. The Margolus neighborhood is an exception because that neighborhood imposes a very unnatural structure that is external to the lattice and the cell's state.

Returns:
Any additional information that is stored by the cell. May be null if there is no information.

getPreviousState

public CellState getPreviousState()
Gets the previous state of this cell (the state at the current generation minus 1).

Returns:
Returns the previous state or null if the previous state does not yet exist.

getRule

public Rule getRule()
Get the rule for updating this cell.

Returns:
Returns the rule.

getState

public CellState getState()
Get the current state of this cell.

Returns:
Returns the state.

getState

public CellState getState(int generation)
Get the state of this cell for a particular generation (or time step). Returns null if the cell no longer holds that information. The number of generations held is specified by the constructor.

Parameters:
generation - The time for which the state will be retrieved.
Returns:
Returns the state (null if the cell no longer holds information for that generation).

getStateHistory

public FiniteArrayList<CellState> getStateHistory()
Get the history of states of this cell, including the current state. The list may contain empty elements if the cell has not yet been updated enough times to fill the list.

Returns:
Returns a history of this cell's states with the oldest state stored as the first element and the current state stored as the last element.

getView

public static CellStateView getView()
Gets the view associated with this cell.

Returns:
The view used to display the cell on the screen.

isTagged

public boolean isTagged()
True when the cell has been tagged for special purposes such as extra visibility.

Returns:
true if the cell is tagged for special purposes such as extra visibility.

setGeneration

public void setGeneration(int generation)
Set the generation of the cell's current state. Under most circumstances, this method is unnecessary because the cell keeps track of its current state.

Parameters:
generation - The generation that will be used for the cell's current state.

setOtherCellInformation

public void setOtherCellInformation(java.lang.Object key,
                                    java.lang.Object value)
Sets any other information that needs to be stored by the cell. For example, the Margolus neighborhood needs the cell to keep track of its position as the northwest, northeast, southeast, or southwest corner of the neighborhood. (This information is not technically part of the cell's state so it is most appropriately stored in this location, separate from the state.)

In general, this method should be unnecessary. All information about the cell should be stored in the state. The Margolus neighborhood is an exception because that neighborhood imposes a very unnatural structure that is external to the lattice and the cell's state.

Parameters:
key - A key for setting (and retrieving) any additional information stored by the cell.
value - The value of any additional information that needs to be stored by the cell.

setRule

public void setRule(Rule rule)
Specify a rule for updating the cell's state.

Parameters:
rule - The rule used to update the cell state.

setTagged

public void setTagged(boolean tagged,
                      java.lang.Object taggingObject)
When set to true, the cell will be tagged for special purposes (such as an extra-visible display, or keeping track of the cell in an analysis). For example, the CellStateView may opt to display this cell's state in bright red rather than a normal color. The CellStateView is not obligated to display tagged states in any special color, but usually will. A unique tagged color is reserved for the specified taggingObject.

Parameters:
tagged - true if the cell should be tagged for special purposes such as extra-visible display.
taggingObject - The object that is doing the tagging (usually an analysis).

removeCurrentState

public void removeCurrentState()
Removes the current state of this cell and decrements the generation. In other words, replaces the most recent state with the previous state. This method is necessary when "rewinding" the CA (for example, with the Back button).

If there are not enough states to rewind, nothing happens.

resetPreviousState

public void resetPreviousState(CellState state)
Reset the previous state of this cell without incrementing the history and without changing the current state. In other words, replace the previous state with the one provided.

Parameters:
state - The state.

resetState

public void resetState(CellState state)
Reset the current state of this cell without incrementing the history. In other words, replace the most recent state with the one provided.

Parameters:
state - The state.

rollBackStates

public void rollBackStates()
Similar to removeCurrentState, but does not decrement the generation. This rolls back the states of the cell without changing the generation. In other words, every state in the cell's history is moved up; the previous state becomes the current state, for example.

toInt

public int toInt()
The state of the cell cast to an int. If the state is not naturally represented as an integer, then the hash value for the cell's associated CellState object is returned (as specified by toInt in the CellState API).

Returns:
the value of the cell's state as an int.
See Also:
toInt()

toInt

public final int toInt(int generation)
The state of the cell (as an int) at the specified generation. If the state is not naturally represented as an integer, then the hash value for the cell's associated CellState object is returned (as specified by toInt in the CellState API).

Returns:
the value of the cell's state for a particular generation.
See Also:
toInt()

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
The state of the cell evaluated as a string.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the value of the cell's state as a string.

updateState

public void updateState(Cell[] neighbors)
Updates the cell's state based on the rule.

NOTE: this method is not synchronized because it calls addNewState() which is synchronized. It is not necessary to synchronize twice. In fact, if this method is synchronized, the code will deadlock. (One thread will lock this cell while updating, and at the same time another thread has a lock on updating the neighbor. Each thread has to read the state of the other as a neighboring cell. Neither thread can continue until the other thread finishes updating.) Furthermore, the call to calculateNewStateForCell() is time consuming and therefore is best left out of the synchronized block.

Parameters:
neighbors - Neighbors of the cell, which are usually required in calculating the new state. Neighbors typically include the cell itself. May be null if the rule does not need neighbors or finds them itself.
